Key Match Events: Patrik Schick cancelled out Georges Mikautadze’s strike as Georgia and Czech Republic played out a 1-1 draw at the Volksparkstadion.
Georgia took a deserved lead on the stroke of half-time with a penalty converted calmly by their striker, Georges Mikautadze after a somewhat controversial VAR check for handball from Robin Hranac.
Czech Republic began to dominate the ball with their set pieces clearly causing all sorts of issues at the back for Georgia and it was not long before Schick bundled in a corner to equalise.
Hlozek believes he has scored for Czech Republic but replays show he scored with his arm and the goal is ruled out.
Georgia break with a three on one. The shot at the end is put over the bar and the final kick of the game could have won the game for Georgia.
Post-Match Reflections: The result means both teams go into the final round of group games at Euro 2024 capable of qualifying for the last 16.
The Czechs will be disappointed that they could not take advantage of their dominance at set pieces to register their first win at the tournament.
Vladimir Coufal played a huge role in helping his country come from behind to remain in contention for qualification.
